originalText.text: I've lived here for nearly 3 years, and it is absolutely my favorite place I've ever lived. Arlene and Regina are kind, thoughtful, responsive, and professional. They treat their tenants with care, which is not something you come by every day here in NYC! I would recommend living at a Gioia property to anyone. The building and units are clean, well-maintained, and the neighbors are all wonderful!

originalText.text: the past five years have been nothing short of delightful and excellent. regina's diligence as a manager; owner, rick's heart of gold; and the godsend/superintendent, viktor, make up gioia's team, which invariably is all a tenant would seek in an agency

text.text: the past five years have been nothing short of delightful and excellent. regina's diligence as a manager; owner, rick's heart of gold; and the godsend/superintendent, viktor, make up gioia's team, which invariably is all a tenant would seek in an agency

originalText.text: I'm moving to a new apartment just a few blocks away, and the part of living in my apt. that i'll miss the most, outside of (Sunny and Annie's up the block) is having Gioia as my landlord. In the 13yrs I've been renting apartments, Gioia has by far the best  landlord I have ever come across. The first place I looked when I was looking for a new apartment was the Gioia website. Anytime I've ever had a question or an issue, they've responded and/or sent a super out within a day (usually within an hour) to fix it. Every single person I've come across that works for Gioia has been kind, thoughtful and fair. I can't say enough nice things about Rick and the rest of his team.

originalText.text: I’ve been with gioia and three years and they’re great. The super they work with is fantastic and they can always get someone to the apartment same day or next day if we ever have any problems. They’ve listened to tenants as we make suggestions for the building when we had an issue with packages stolen. They’re also really nice!

originalText.text: I was on the verge of homelessness coming to this country. In my small home town in El Salvador, my wife took our pet pig Sophie as well as all of our sons. She left me with our daughters. I thought to myself, I am 37 years old, I still have my life to live. I gave my daughters to my sister and traveled by boat to America to make a name for myself. I've been living here for 3 years but all of a sudden, my contract ended and the prices and living conditions were completely unreasonable for my budget. I was getting dollar slices of pizza for lunch and I forgot my wallet. The cashier was giving me a hard time and a man named Viktor came and paid for me. He chatted me up and I told him I was looking for a place to rent and he told me to look no further and that I just found an opportunity. He connected me with the front desk which consisted of an extremely handsome young man named Cameron and a charismatic and extremely charming woman named Arlene. Within 2 hours, they processed my application, took my security deposit, and found me a place to rent for the year. It has now been a few months since I moved in and this man Viktor is the nicest super there is. Whenever I have any concerns or questions, I ask Arlene or Cameron and they give me a straight answer right away. Gioia Realty is the greatest thing that has happened to me in 2021 and I highly recommend doing business with them.
